newsitem.title: EGYPT: Egypt's CIB 1996 profit up 10.8 pct. [CORRECTED 09:33 GMT]
newsitem.headline: Egypt's CIB 1996 profit up 10.8 pct. [CORRECTED 09:33 GMT]

text.p: (Corrects percentage increase in headline from 41.6 pct)

Commercial International Bank net income rose to 241.3 million pounds ($71 million) in the year ending December 31, 1996 compared to 217.7 million pounds the previous year, said a CIB statement in newspapers on Thursday.
It said assets rose to 10.95 billion pounds in 1996 from 7.77 billion pounds the previous year. Shareholders' equity was 1.08 billion pounds in 1996, up from 963 million.
CIB said it would hold its annual general meeting on May 29. It said it was proposed to pay cash dividends of 20 percent of the nominal value of shares to shareholders.
